isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: ROCKWELL - ASSEMBLY - INSTALL WHEEL BEARINGS INTO HUBS

step1.para: If wheel studs were removed from the hub, put the hub in a press with the drum side at the bottom. Align the grooves on the studs with the grooves in the stud holes in the hub. Press the studs into position.

note.para: If a press is not available, use a brass hammer or drift.

warning.para: Do not hit the hubs with a steel hammer. Damage to the parts can occur and broken parts can cause injury.

step1.para: Install the inner and outer bearing cups into the hub. Use a press and sleeve ( Figure 36).
Fill the bearing cones and hub cavity with the correct grease until it is level with the inside diameter of the bearing cones. Refer to GROUP 10-LUBRICATION for the proper lubricant.
Install the inner bearing cone in its cup inside the hub.
Install a new inner oil seal. Apply a layer of non-hardening sealing compound to the outside of the seal and install the seal into its correct position against the bore.

note.para: Do not force or hit the seal after it has touched the bottom of the bore. The seal can be damaged.

step1.para: Install the oil sleeve on the spindle.
Install the hub assembly on to the spindle. Be careful the oil seal is not damaged during installation. Press the hub until the inner bearing is flat against the face of the spindle.
Install the outer bearing cone on the spindle and press it into its cup inside the hub.
